node.title: Amazon Selling 'Grinch' Shirts Accusing Biden, Dominion Voting of 'Stealing' Election
node.alt: The Dominion Voting Systems logo and the text "Property of Dominion Voting" is featured in a closeup of the shirt offered for sale by Amazon in this screenshot taken from Amazon.Com.
node.description: Dominion has filed lawsuits against multiple organizations and individuals for falsely claiming the company helped "steal" the 2020 election from Donald Trump.
node.content:
["Amazon is selling a Christmas-themed t-shirt accusing President Joe Biden of \"stealing\" the 2020 presidential election fraud with Dominion Voting Systems.", "Biden is depicted as Dr. Seuss' \"Grinch\" character on shirts and other items offered for sale by the eCommerce giant as of Tuesday. Most feature the phrase \"How Biden Stole The Election,\" with one popular image featuring the green-skinned president holding a sack stamped with a logo from Dominion Voting Systems and the text \"Property of Dominion Voting.\" Vice President Kamala Harris is also depicted as the presidential Grinch's dog companion, Max.", "Dominion sued conservative media outlets Newsmax and One America News Network (OANN), as well as several individuals like MyPillow CEO Mike Lindell, for billions of dollars earlier this year over promoting false claims about the company taking part in a baseless conspiracy theory that asserts last year's election was \"stolen\" from former President Donald Trump.", "", "
Amazon is offering election fraud conspiracy-themed Christmas t-shirts featuring President Joe Biden as Dr. Seuss' \"Grinch\" character holding a sack that says \"Property of Dominion Voting\" alongside Vice President Kamala Harris as his dog companion. One of the shirts offered for sale is pictured in this screenshot taken from Amazon.Com.
", "The items for sale on Amazon included multiple different illustrations of Biden as the Grinch, some that appeared to be edited by superimposing a green version of the president's face onto a Dr. Seuss illustration. An alternate version of the image showed the character holding sacks labeled \"Foreign Interference China,\" \"Mail-In Ballots,\" \"Voter Fraud\" and \"Election Fraud.\"", "In addition to t-shirts, Amazon was offering the illustrations on sweatshirts, coffee mugs Christmas-themed \"ugly sweaters,\" Christmas ornaments and notebooks. Prices ranged from $31.99 for a sweatshirt to $3.82 for a small blank notebook. Most of the items included free Amazon Prime shipping and returns.", "", "
A selection of Amazon items featuring an election-stealing President Joe Biden as the Grinch are featured in this screenshot from Amazon.Com.
", "Although some of the anti-Biden Grinch items may have been sold by third-party sellers using Amazon's platform, at least one of the shirts featuring the altered image of Biden and the Dominion logo was labeled as \"Ships from Amazon.Com\" and \"Sold by Amazon.Com.\"", "The company previously insisted that third-party sellers were to blame after facing heavy criticism for profiting off sales of offensive and politically-charged merchandise featuring slogans like \"Joe and the Hoe\" in the run-up to last year's election.", "", "
This screenshot taken from Amazon.Com shows a version of the Joe Biden Grinch shirt that \"Ships from Amazon.Com\" and is \"Sold by Amazon.\"
", "Hundreds of items that explicitly featured the phrase \"F**k Joe Biden\" were also offered for sale by Amazon. A smaller but still significant number of items featuring \"F**k Donald Trump\" were also offered, while a still smaller amount of \"Joe and the Hoe\" merchandise was available.", "There is no credible evidence to support claims that massive fraud took place during the 2020 election, with or without the help of Dominion. Biden defeated Trump by an unambiguous margin of over 7 million popular votes and 74 Electoral College votes. A recent review by a Wisconsin conservative group concluded that Democrats actually did worse than expected in areas that had installed Dominion equipment.", "", "
The Dominion Voting Systems logo and the text \"Property of Dominion Voting\" is featured in a closeup of the shirt offered for sale by Amazon in this screenshot taken from Amazon.Com.
"]
